column4: hi - anyone running ubuntu on a thinkpad t20/t21/t22 with ACPI who has s3 sleep working? mine already crashes on resume
can you get s1 working?

and it may not be worth the headache to insist on s3
in S1 - how much power does it take more compared to S3?
I think it's detectable.. i.e., twice as much power or something.
but s3 is really good - days.. so you go from several days to maybe a day
but display etc. all is still off?
yeah. it's good.. do this:
pico (or nano) /etc/defaults/acpi-support
yeah i know this file thx
and in there, change it from "mem" to "standby"
that's changing s3 -> s1

other than that, you're really going to spend lots and lots of time, and it may not fully work anyway.. For example, I spent weeks on my s3, and in the end, there was no way to get the sound driver to reinitialize no matter what, so I had to drop back to s1 anyhow
